title: Hillsborough inquest verdicts: South Yorkshire reaction - BBC News
summary: hillsborough fans unlawfully killed , inquests conclude .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: good evening : your live coverage across the day
text: scroll down the page for full coverage of the hillsborough inquests on what 's been a very difficult day for authorities in south yorkshire .
flowers and tributes continue to be laid at the football stadium in sheffield .
today 's momentous verdict belongs to the 96 men , women and children who were 'unlawfully killed ' at the disaster at sheffield wednesday 's ground on 15 april 1989 .
all 96 are profiled on special bbc news page .
justice for the 96 and their families , but with news the crown prosecution service will now begin considering criminal charges over hillsborough , the story 's far from over .
we 'll be back from 08:00 on wednesday with the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the county .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: hillsborough inquests summary : the main points
text: here are some of the main points raised in what 's been a momentus day for liverpool campaigners and a very difficult day for authorities in south yorkshire
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: watch : what happened at hillsborough ?
text: details of how the days events unfolded and resulted in the biggest sporting disaster the country 's ever seen :
what happened at hillsborough ?
timeline of how the day 's events unfolded here :
@ twitterid @ twitterid what a tit .
@ twitterid @ twitterid good old bbc .
one of the first to spread malicious rumours .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: look north prepares for a hillsborough special from 18:30 bbc1
text: preparing for @ twitterid hillsborough special .
join us 6.30pm

documents.title: hillsborough inquests summary : the main points
text: here are some of the main points raised in what 's been a momentus day for liverpool campaigners and a very difficult day for authorities in south yorkshire
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: watch : hillsborough campaigner trevor hicks - 'i lost everything that day '
text: trevor hicks lost his two teenage daughters , sarah :
and vicki , in the‪ # ‎hillsborough‬ disaster .
he was involved in desperate efforts on the pitch to save his girls and since that terrible day , he 's campaigned for the truth :
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: look north live from hillsborough 18:30 bbc1
text: it 's been described as `` the greatest injustice ever '' .
the longest inquest in legal history has finally given justice to the 96 fans who perished at hillsborough .
we 're live at the stadium in sheffield this evening for a very special edition of bbc look north .
the disaster was 27 years ago and it 's taken decades of campaigning to get to the truth and to reveal the failings of the emergency services .
we now know that there was a cover up involving senior police officers .
more on the verdicts , the cover-ups and all the analysis , this evening from 18:30 on bbc1 .
author: BBC Look North, Yorkshire

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : the role of police chief david duckenfield
text: inquests into the 96 football fans who died in the 1989 hillsborough disaster have concluded they were unlawfully killed , with the jury finding match commander - former ch supt david duckenfield - `` responsible for manslaughter by gross negligence '' due to a breach of his duty of care .
mr duckenfield ( below in 1989 ) said in the pressure of the day he froze and did not consider the consequences of his actions .
`` i think it 's fair to say that it is arguably one of the biggest regrets of my life , that i did not foresee where fans would go when they came in through the gates , '' he said .
he also admitted to a `` terrible lie '' .
`` everybody knew the truth , the fans and police knew the truth that we 'd opened the gates , '' he said .
when asked if his `` negligence '' caused the disaster he told the inquest : `` i would n't use the word negligence sir .
mistake .
oversight i did my very best on the day . ''
read more about his role on the day , here .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: hillsborough inquest verdicts spur orgreave truth and justice campaign
text: the orgreave truth and justice campaign ( otjc ) have released a statement paying tribute to the dedication and tireless commitment of the 'formidable ' hillsborough campaigners .
they 've said the victory of hillsborough campaigners has motivated them further to demand a full public inquiry into the policing at orgreave .
about 10,000 miners and 5,000 police officers were involved in the confrontation at orgreave on 18 june 1984 , known as the battle of orgreave .
i am overjoyed that justice has finally been done for the hillsborough families .
the verdicts demonstrate that with the determination and public support campaigners can overturn miscarriages of justice .
the verdicts will spur on the otjc and its demand for a full public inquiry into the policing at orgreave on 18 june 1984 . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: sheffield city council : `` 15th april 1989 a dark day in sheffield and liverpool 's history '
text: sheffield city council has released the following statement following the hillsborough inquests :
we welcome the conclusion of the inquests with the announcement of the jury 's formal findings .
i very much hope that these findings will bring some peace to the families of the 96 people who tragically died that day .
the fifteenth of april 1989 is a dark day in the history of both sheffield and liverpool and we are truly sorry for the losses the families have endured .
as always our thoughts and sympathies are with them above all .
we have always accepted and continue to accept our errors in the safety certification of hillsborough stadium in 1989 .
we unreservedly apologised for those failings and we repeat that apology . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: hillsborough football ground : tributes for the 96
text: following the verdicts today , people have been leaving these tributes for the 96 victims of the hillsborough disaster at the football ground in sheffield .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: watch : south yorkshire police 'unequivocally ' accept jury 's conclusions
text: south yorkshire chief constable david crompton said : `` very many lessons have been learned in the way major sporting events are policed . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: hillsborough coroner thanks jury for 'remarkable commitment '
text: the jury have returned to the court for concluding remarks and coroner sir john goldring has told them their `` commitment and diligence has been remarkable '' .
it prompted standing applause from people in the public gallery .

documents.title: 'official confirmation that liverpool fans were utterly blameless ' , says prime minister
text: prime minister david cameron has said the findings of the inquests were `` official confirmation that liverpool fans were utterly blameless '' for the disaster .
he earlier called it a `` landmark day '' that `` provides long overdue justice '' .
author: Jenny Coleman
Reporter, BBC Local Live

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : 'sole focus ' on criminal inquiry
text: the man in charge of the criminal inquiry into the hillsborough disaster has said his `` sole focus '' is now on completing the investigation , hopefully by the end of the year .

assistant commissioner jon stoddart , who is leading operation resolve , said his investigators had supported coroner sir john goldring by providing him with thousands of documents , witness statements and reports alongside the criminal investigation .
he said the crown prosecution service will then consider the evidence and decide whether any individual or organisation should face criminal prosecution .
author: Emma Stanley
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: your views : hillsborough verdicts
text: following the verdicts at the hillsborough inquest , you 've been sharing some of your thoughts on our facebook page :
justice ''
the people that ordered the cover up should face prosecution . ''
so glad they got the justice but how terrible it 's been having to wait for 27 years to get the right outcome .
may all the 96 now rest in peace .
you 'll never be forgotten xx . ''
27 years before they had justice
bet not one copper is ever jailed for it . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: watch : hillsborough memorial in sheffield
text: i 'm at hillsborough football ground this afternoon , where tributes have been left in memory of the 96 who were 'unlawfully killed ' .
the hillsborough memorial in sheffield today bedecked with flowers and tributes @ twitterid
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: police 'tried to deflect blame ' say victims ' families
text: barry devonside , whose son christopher died in the disaster , told a press conference with the families that south yorkshire police `` tried to deflect blame '' onto supporters and `` any other convenient organisation '' .

stephen wright , whose brother graham was one of the 96 , said today 's conclusions `` put the serious failures '' of the police `` centre stage '' , saying primary responsibility `` lies at their door and in particular at the feet of mr duckenfield '' .

he said police legal teams continued to pursue `` the denials of the past , blaming mythical , late , drunken ticketless fans for the deaths of their loved ones , '' and called for the immediate resignation of chief constable david crompton .
author: Jenny Coleman
Reporter, BBC Local Live

there have been calls for those responsible to now be brought to justice .

documents.title: breakingvictims ' families call for resignation of chief constable and head of yorkshire ambulance service
text: families of the victims called for the chief constable of south yorkshire police and the head of the county 's ambulance service to resign immediately .

at a press conference following the verdicts of the two-year inquest , which recorded a decision of unlawful killing of the 96 liverpool fans , the families of the hillsborough justice campaign made the calls .
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: your comments : family and friends of 96 victims celebrate inquest verdicts
text: following the verdicts of the inquests into the 96 deaths at hillsborough , families and relatives sang `` you 'll never walk alone '' outside the court .
the song has long been associated with liverpool football club and has also come to symbolise the families ' campaign for fresh inquests .
you 've been leaving your reaction to this video and the verdicts on our facebook page
they never gave up , well done liverpool fans and families , justice for the 96 , you 'll never walk alone . ''
the emotion of the families here is amazing if not for the determination of these brave family members the whitewash would have remained shame on the police shame on the establishment . ''
horrified that this has taken so long , and uncovered too much atrocious behaviour from people and institutions that we should be able to trust .
at least some form of justice has finally been served , but at what cost ! ''
respect to the families for their determination , respect to the people of liverpool for their support and damnation to all those who lied and tried to hide the truth . ''
hard to believe there could have been any other verdict - 96 people went to a football match and never came home , today their families have got justice . ''

i just want to say well done to the family 's who have never given up and got justice for their loved ones after 27 years its been a long time coming i feel ashamed that its took this long how these family 's have suffered and the loved ones that died were made out to be the ones at fault god bless all those family 's and now there loved one can finally rest in peace xx ''
author: BBC Look North, Yorkshire

documents.title: cost of the hillsborough inquests to south yorkshire pcc reach £ 25m
text: the office of the police and crime commissioner has detailed the cost of the hillsborough inquests to the south yorkshire police budget :
incurred costs to the total of £ 24.7m up to 31 march 2016 .
special grant funding of £ 20.4m was secured from the home office , leaving a net cost to the pcc of £ 4.3m .
the costs for 2016/17 are yet to be invoiced and these are estimated to be in the region of £ 0.4m . ''
author: Liz Roberts
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: lawyers : 'catastrophic human failure ' and 'culture of denial '
text: lawyers who led the legal team representing some of the families said the disaster was `` entirely avoidable '' ; it was `` no accident '' and `` no natural phenomenon '' but was `` caused by catastrophic human failure '' - above all by the police .
the families were then subjected to lies by senior officers covering up their role , vile abuse in parts of the media , and a campaign to blame supporters .
what we have witnessed is public authorities led by people who put defence of the institution over the truth , over learning for the future and over serving the public .
we have witnessed a 'culture of denial ' writ large . ''
author: Emma Stanley
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: in quotes : key moments in evidence given to hillsborough inquests
text: richard chester , sheffield wednesday club secretary from 1984 to 1986 , explaining why he secretly took out 250 away leppings lane tickets for sale at two all-ticket matches in the 1984/85 season :
i wanted a little bit of protection and a little bit of back-up .
you appreciate that if you have taken an area of terracing out that is not available , then logically you can not have the same number of people . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: we will continue to 'recognise , remember and learn ' , says the fa
text: the football association has just released a statement :
our sincere condolences remain with the families and friends of the victims .
they have conducted themselves with great dignity throughout these inquests , during which there has been an exhaustive investigation of the horrific circumstances that took place 27 years ago .
ultimately , the inquests stand as testament to the struggle undertaken by the families so the truth might be brought to light .
while much has changed since 1989 , the fa and english football in general must continue to recognise , remember and learn from the tragedy .
in looking forward , it is important we never forget .
given the ongoing criminal investigations , there are limitations to what we can say .
it is in the interests of all concerned that further consideration of the disaster by the relevant authorities must be allowed to take its course . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: south yorkshire police federation : 'today 's policing standards were not in place 27 years ago '
text: south yorkshire police federation chairman neil bowles has given a press conference responding to the inquest conclusions of the hillsborough disaster :
our members did their best on that day and followed orders ''
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: watch : chair of south yorkshire police federation responds to hillsborough verdicts
text: neil bowles chair of the sypolice federation `` more answers will be needed as the outcome of the inquest sinks in ''

documents.title: south yorkshire police federation : 'our officers did their best '
text: in light of the conclusions at the hillsborough inquests , south yorkshire police federation have made the following statement :
our members - ordinary officers - went to work on that day in 1989 expecting a normal day , policing a football match , but walked into an unfolding disaster .
they did their best . ''
author: Ed Thomas
BBC News

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : 'i do not accept your apology , mr duckenfield '
text: charlotte hennessy 's father james hennessy was killed in the 1989 hillsborough stadium disaster .
she kept a video diary throughout the two years of the inquests .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: families ' concerns over freemasons membership examined
text: the question of whether freemasons membership influenced decision-making over the hillsborough disaster has been investigated by the police watchdog .
match commander chief supt david duckenfield told the fresh inquests he had been a freemason since 1975 and became head of his local lodge - a worshipful master - the year after the 1989 disaster .
the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) has examined concerns from the hillsborough families over freemason membership .

it says the united grand lodge of england provided information , including attendance records , which enabled investigators to assess whether there may be some correlation with individuals involved in decision-making around hillsborough .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: coroner and jury return briefly to court
text: the jury were called back into court to sign the 96 records of the inquest .
the coroner asks that only the seven jurors who were in agreement in respect of question 6 - the unlawful killing question - should sign them .
court is then adjourned until 16:00 , with the coroner adding : `` i anticipate you will not be kept very long thereafter . ''

documents.title: south yorkshire police federation to comment shortly
text: following the statement by the chief constable , the rank-and-file police officer 's union , the police federation , is to make a statement shortly .

documents.title: hillsborough lawyers say families 'deserved better '
text: lawyers representing some of the families of the hillsborough disaster said it was caused by failure `` of [ sheffield wednesday fc ] , the engineers and the licensing authorities '' to ensure a safe stadium , `` failure of the ambulance service to react competently '' and above all `` catastrophic policing failure '' .

`` the families and all of us in the general public deserved better '' , said marcia stewart , who led the legal team , adding : `` we hope the conduct of the public authorities will be given the greatest scrutiny in the coming days and weeks . ''
author: Jenny Coleman
Reporter, BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'i do not accept the police apology ' , says victim 's mother
text: the mother of a 17-year-old hillsborough victim says she does not accept the apology from south yorkshire police .
mary corrigan , whose son keith mcgrath was one of the 96 who died in the disaster , said : `` they have had 27 years to tell us the truth.and to say what happened .
`` we have had to fight so many lies and they have the nerve to say they apologise today . ''
author: Emma Stanley
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: watch : south yorkshire force 's policing at hillsborough 'catastrophically wrong '
text: chief con david crompton @ twitterid `` we unequivocally accept the verdict of unlawful killing '' # hillsborough
author: Ed Thomas
BBC News

documents.title: trevor hicks gives a thumbs up outside court
text: trevor hicks , whose daughters sarah and vicki died at hillsborough , gives a thumbs up after hearing the unlawful killing verdict at the inquest at the court in warrington .

documents.title: listen : south yorkshire police say 'many lessons have been learned '
text: i 'm at the police headquarters for south yorkshire police in carbrook house , sheffield .
chief constable david crompton says : `` very many lessons have been learned in the way major sporting events are policed . ''
listen to the full statement here :
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: hillsborough families sing after unlawful killing conclusion
text: these were the celebrations outside the court in warrington a little earlier after the jury concluded the 96 hillsborough victims were unlawfully killed .
you 've been giving your reaction to the verdicts on our facebook page :
about time terrible ! ''
justice for the 96 good people . ''
at last justice ! !
finally justice for the 96 and their families . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: breakingsouth yorkshire police 'unequivocally accept verdict of unlawful killing '
text: south yorkshire police says it `` unequivocally accepts the verdict of unlawful killing '' .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: the independent complaints commission : what happens now ?
text: the hillsborough investigations are the biggest undertaking ever for the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) .
following the conclusions by the jury at the hillsborough inquiry , the ipcc has released a blog to explain a little about what we can expect now :
at this stage it is important to understand that the conclusions of the inquests are not the end of the process .
both criminal investigations - the ipcc and operation resolve - will remain ongoing following the jury 's conclusions .
while the inquests have proceeded we have been working to supply both the coroner with the information he has needed to complete the inquests , but also to progress our criminal investigations .

now that our role in relation to the inquests has ended , our priority is concluding our criminal investigations and ensuring the crown prosecution service ( cps ) has comprehensive files of evidence to allow charging decisions to be made .
it is important to remember that the cps will make these decisions independently . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: mp for bassetlaw : south yorkshire police needs merger or new regional focus
text: bassetlaw 's labour mp john mann has called for south yorkshire police to be disbanded following the verdicts at the hillsborough inquest .
he has praised officers currently working at the force and says they deserve a `` fresh start '' .
he then gives two options for the future of the force :
there are two clear options to bring this about - either by creating a police force based on sheffield city region or a merger with west yorkshire police . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: analysis : could criminal proceedings now follow ?
text: a lot of evidence has come to light here and in the [ ongoing ] police investigation .
a lot of work has already been done and the criminal justice system now kicks in .
the inquest has done its job and now the criminal justice system takes over .
the independent police complaints commission are looking at both organisations and individuals .
author: Clive Coleman
BBC legal correspondent

documents.title: breakingsouth yorkshire police to issue statement shortly
text: after all the hillsborough inquests verdicts are heard today , chief constable david crompton will issue a statement .

documents.title: hillsborough engineers : 'we 're sorry '
text: statement from # hillsborough engineers eastwood & partners :
`` we would like to say sorry on behalf of the company at that time '' .
author: Judith Moritz
BBC North of England Correspondent

documents.title: south yorkshire mp : 'clear errors by policing ' at hillsborough
text: following the verdict of `` unlawful killing '' for the 96 victims of the hillsborough disaster , caroline flint , the labour mp for don valley has said :

the jury have issued a clear decision that there were clear errors by the policing , in the plan for managing the crowd , on the day of the match , in the control box , and including the actions of the commanding officers the inquest also determined that sheffield wednesday club were culpable for the poor certification after the leppings lane end had been modified ; and over the way turnstiles were organised .
the jury also determined that ambulance service errors also contributed to the deaths . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: conclusions of first coroner dismissed in court
text: the names , times and causes of death of the 96 victims of hillsborough are being read in court .
the jury finds that many of the 96 may have died well after 15:15 - this dismisses the first coroner 's opinion .
author: Judith Moritz
BBC North of England Correspondent

documents.title: live from court : names of the victims read
text: in court , the names of the 96 are read individually .
cause and time of death are being given .
# hillsborough
author: Judith Moritz
BBC North of England Correspondent

documents.title: south yorkshire police 's 'credibility irreparably damaged ' , says mp
text: following the jury 's conclusion that 96 liverpool fans were unlawfully killed at hillsborough in 1989 , bassetlaw labour mp john mann has called for south yorkshire police to be closed down and reconfigured .
nobody should pre-judge ongoing inquiries into the police , but whatever conclusions they reach , the credibility of the institution of south yorkshire police has been irreparably damaged .
it needs a new identity and more importantly a new ethos and ethics .
south yorkshire police should be disbanded . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: breakingbassetlaw mp calls for south yorkshire force to be disbanded
text: bassetlaw mp john mann calls for south yorkshire police to be `` closed down and reconfigured '' following the conclusions of the hillsborough inquests .
he says the force needs `` a new identity '' .
author: BBC Look North, Yorkshire

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : court resumes proceedings
text: court now resuming to hear the cause and time of deaths of each of the 96 # hillsborough victims .

documents.title: breakingstatements from cps , ipcc and operation resolve following hillsborough inquests finding
text: the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) , operation resolve and the crown prosecution service ( cps ) have issued statements following today 's conclusions .
read the statements here .

documents.title: reaction outside court to jury 's conclusions
text: i 'm outside the court , during break , where barry devonside , father of chris , has told me : on the jury 's 14 answers : `` it feels like 14 goals '' .
author: Judith Moritz
BBC North of England Correspondent

documents.title: breakingcps to look at criminal charges following hillsborough inquests
text: following today 's verdicts , the crown prosecution service confirms it will now begin considering criminal charges over hillsborough .

documents.title: what we know : the hillsborough inquests
text: the jury at the hillsborough inquests have concluded :
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: hillsborough inquests to resume in 10 minutes
text: the inquests into the hillsborough disaster will resume at 12:00 .

documents.title: relatives react outside court in warrington as jury delivers conclusions
text: ninety six football fans who died as a result of a crush in the 1989 hillsborough disaster were unlawfully killed , the inquests have concluded .
the jury decided the match commander ch supt david duckenfield 's actions amounted to `` gross negligence '' due to a breach of his duty of care to fans .
a relative reacts after the jury delivered its conclusions at the new inquests into the hillsborough disaster in warrington .
conclusions are reached on all 96 deaths at the hillsborough inquest .
author: Ben Schofield
Hillsborough reporter, BBC Radio Merseyside

documents.title: tears in court after hillsborough conclusions are delivered
text: i 'm in court where families have been clapping as the jury left court for break .
one lady shouts `` god bless the jury '' # hillsborough .
trevor hicks , who 's been a main figure in the campaign on behalf of the victims , has told me : `` we 've done it ! ''
victim 's lawyers are also crying - along with the shadow home secretary , andy burnham - the families are hugging - and people saying they ca n't take in enormity of it all .
author: Judith Moritz
BBC North of England Correspondent

documents.title: court break at inquests
text: court now taking a break until 11:50 .

documents.title: question 14 : emergency response and the role of south yorkshire ambulance service
text: after the crush in the west terrace had begun to develop , was there any error or omission by the ambulance service ( symas ) which caused or contributed to the loss of lives in the disaster ?
yes or no .
yes .
symas failed to ascertain the nature of the problem at leppings lane .
the failure to recognise and call a major incident led to delays in response to the emergency .
author: Ben Schofield
Hillsborough reporter, BBC Radio Merseyside

documents.title: david duckenfield 's lawyer in court
text: david duckenfield 's lawyer seen in court carefully noting jury 's conclusions .
propping up his head with one hand .
author: Ben Schofield
Hillsborough reporter, BBC Radio Merseyside

documents.title: south yorkshire police 'delayed calling a major incident '
text: in giving their verdict the jury have said : `` the police delayed calling a major incident , lack of command and control '' .
author: Judith Moritz
BBC North of England Correspondent

documents.title: question 13 : emergency response and the role of south yorkshire police
text: after the crush in the west terrace had begun to develop , was there any error or omission by the police which caused or contributed to the loss of lives in the disaster ?
yes or no .
yes .

documents.title: question 12 : conduct of eastwood & partners ( swfc engineers )
text: should eastwood & partners have done more to detect and advise on any unsafe or unsatisfactory features of the stadium which caused or contributed to the disaster ?
yes or no .
yes .

documents.title: question 11 : conduct of sheffield wednesday fc on the day of the match
text: was there any error or omission by swfc and its staff on 15 april 1989 which caused or contributed to the dangerous situation that developed at the leppings lane turnstiles and in the west terrace ?
yes or no .
no .

was there any error or omission by swfc and its staff on 15 april 1989 which may have caused or contributed to the dangerous situation that developed at the leppings lane turnstiles and in the west terrace ?
yes or no .
yes .

documents.title: question 10 : conduct of sheffield wednesday fc before the day of the match
text: was there any error or omission by swfc and its staff in the management of the stadium and/or preparation for the semi final match on 15 april 1989 which caused or contributed to the dangerous situation which developed on the day of the match ?
yes or no .
yes .

documents.title: question 9 : licensing and oversight of the stadium
text: was there any error or omission in the safety certification and oversight of hillsborough stadium that caused or contributed to the disaster ?
yes or no .
yes .

documents.title: question 8 : defects in hillsborough stadium
text: were there any features of the design , construction and layout of the stadium which you consider were dangerous or defective and which caused or contributed to the disaster ?
yes or no .
yes .
author: Ben Schofield
Hillsborough reporter, BBC Radio Merseyside

documents.title: question 7 : any behaviour by fans which caused or contributed ?
text: jury answers no .
shouts of `` yesssss ! ''
when question on fans delivered
author: Judith Moritz
BBC North of England Correspondent

documents.title: breakingquestion 6 : determination on unlawful killing issue
text: are you satisfied , so that you are sure , that those who died in the disaster were unlawfully killed ?
yes or no .
yes .

documents.title: question 5 : the opening of the gates
text: when the order was given to open the exit gates at the leppings lane end of the stadium , was there any error or omission by the commanding officers in the control box which caused or contributed to the crush on the terrace ?
yes or no .
yes .
author: Ben Schofield
Hillsborough reporter, BBC Radio Merseyside

documents.title: question 4 : policing of the match and the crush on the terrace
text: was there any error or omission by commanding officers which caused or contributed to the crush on the terrace ?
yes or no .
yes .
author: Ben Schofield
Hillsborough reporter, BBC Radio Merseyside

documents.title: question 3 : policing of the match and the situation at the turnstiles
text: was there any error or omission in policing on the day of the match which caused or contributed to a dangerous situation developing at the leppings lane turnstiles ?
yes or no .
yes .
author: Emma Stanley
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: question 2 : police planning for the semi-final match
text: was there any error or omission in police planning or preparation for the semi-final match on 15 april 1989 which caused or contributed to the dangerous situation that developed on the day of the match ?
yes or no
yes
author: Emma Stanley
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: hillsborough jury answers yes to first question
text: the jury have entered court , they are six men and three women .
they have been asked the first question .
question 1 : basic facts of the disaster , that 96 people died as result # hillsborough disaster .
jury agrees .
author: Judith Moritz
BBC North of England Correspondent

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : live from south yorkshire police hq
text: i 'm at carbrook house in sheffield , where the world 's media has descended on south yorkshire police hq in sheffield for post-verdict statements .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: from the courtroom : families given jury questionnaire
text: i 'm in court in warrington , where families who want them are being given ( unfilled ) copies of the jury questionnaire to follow proceedings # hillsborough
author: Judith Moritz
BBC North of England Correspondent

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : verdict about to start
text: court about to start .
complete hush in the courtroom # hillsborough

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : the court begins to fill for 11:00 verdict
text: conclusions from the jury following the hillsborough inquests will be delivered at 11:00. in warrington , cheshire .
journalists have been arriving at court to hear the verdict .
i 'm inside the # hillsborough courtroom .
the seats for family members are filling up .
more are queuing outside .
jury conclusions due at 11am
@ twitterid result ?
@ twitterid thanks judith for all your excellent updates and reports covering this inquiry .
let 's hope the families have justice at last !
relatives and reporters still queuing to enter hillsborough inquests court .
# hillsborough : behind the scenes in the media pen and the queue to get into the court .
@ twitterid @ twitterid kelvin mckenzie there ?

documents.title: hillsborough survivors carry flag towards court
text: hillsborough survivors chris lam and campaigner jim sharman carry a flag towards the court .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : the 14 questions the jury will answer from 11:00
text: the jury has been asked to answer 14 detailed questions about what happened at hillsborough , including whether the 96 victims were unlawfully killed and whether opportunities were lost to save lives on the day .
you can read the full list of questions by clicking here .
author: Emma Stanley
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: 'we 've had 75 meetings ' : health secretary speaks to bbc radio sheffield about doctors ' strike
text: it 's the first all-out junior doctors ' strike in england in the history of the nhs .
the nine hour strike is in protest at a new contract the government wants to introduce .
and , for the first time in the escalating dispute , junior doctors will not provide emergency care .
on this morning 's breakfast show , i asked the health secretary what progress he 'd made in the dispute
author: Toby Foster
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : bbc north of england correspondent
text: i 'm at court today for full coverage of the findings in the hillsborough inquests .
i 'll be in the courtroom during the jury conclusions .
there is restricted media seating and i 'll tweet jury findings .
families going into court are being given these tickets .
and the court is expected to be full .
there 's a long queue of # hillsborough families going into the building .
author: Judith Moritz
BBC North of England Correspondent

documents.title: watch : live from the as junior doctors strike in sheffield
text: junior doctors are on strike in a dispute about a new contract and , for the first time , they will not provide emergency care .
i 'm at the hallamshire hospital :
junior drs on the at the hallamshire hospital , sheffield .
# juniordoctorsstrike
@ twitterid doctors deserve better .
hunt must resign .
he is not fit for purpose .
author: Kat Cowan
Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : understanding the verdict
text: the jury at the hillsborough inquests will reveal its conclusions later into how 96 football fans were fatally injured in the 1989 stadium disaster .
the members of the jury have also made conclusions about whether police `` errors or omissions '' caused or contributed to the dangerous situation at the match and the crush on the terraces .
based on the evidence , the jury has also decided whether police and ambulance service responses to the crushing `` contributed to the loss of lives '' .
there are four steps to the jury reaching an unlawful killing conclusion .
only if members of the jury are sure of each , can they conclude the 96 were unlawfully killed .
they are :
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: today 's junior doctors ' strike by sheffield star cartoonist
text: sheffield star cartoonist james whitworth has tweeted his take on today 's all-out strike by junior doctors :
today 's strike @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid # juniordoctorsstrike
@ twitterid hi james - can we use your on our @ twitterid local live and social media pages , please ?
cheers jen
@ twitterid @ twitterid hi jenny - yes , that 's fine .
james .

documents.title: headlines : hillsborough inquests verdict due at 11:00 and first all-out doctors ' strike in the nhs 's history has begun in england .
text: headlines : hillsborough inquests verdict due at 11:00 and first all-out doctors ' strike in the nhs 's history has begun in england .
author: Everard Davy
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: sheffield hole 'likely to be old leadmine '
text: sheffield city council say the `` sinkhole '' that 's opened up on hutcliffe wood road in millhouses , sheffield is likely to be an old lead mine .
contractors say that they were pumping concrete into the hole yesterday .
the road is still closed but there is a temporary footpath .
their advice is to walk with care .
author: Everard Davy
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : jury to deliver its conclusions at 11:00
text: the jury of seven women and three men retired to consider its conclusions ( which used to be known as verdicts ) on 6 april .
the following day , one of the female jurors was discharged on medical grounds .

it was announced on monday that the jury had finished its deliberations - coroner sir john goldring adjourned the inquests in order to give sufficient notice to all interested parties , notably the friends and families of the 96 victims .
author: Emma Stanley
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: south yorkshire consultants sign letter of support for junior doctors ' 'all out strike '
text: the first all-out doctors ' strike in the history of the nhs is under way .
thousands of junior doctors walked out of both routine and emergency care at 08:00 bst in protest at the imposition of a new contract from the summer .
the nine-hour walkout will be repeated tomorrow .
the doctors ' union , the british medical association , says senior colleagues will provide cover .
in south yorkshire , over 260 consultants at sheffield teaching hospitals nhs trust have signed an open letter supporting # juniordoctors
we write to express out support and solidarity we appreciate and understand why you are compelled to take this action and we will endeavour to insure the impact on patient care is minimised . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news

documents.title: weather : a crisp start , windy with highs of 8c
text: a cold and windy day today .
sunny spells and blustery , wintry showers , a mix of rain , sleet and mainly hill snow .
showers becoming widespread by this afternoon and often heavy with the risk of hail and thunder .
author: Kay Crewdson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: a cold and crisp start to the day , full weather report coming shortly .
today we 'll be bringing you full south yorkshire reaction to verdicts at the hillsborough inquiry .
after listening to more than two years of evidence , the jury in the hillsborough inquests will deliver its verdicts this morning .
the six women and three men will decide whether or not the 96 liverpool fans , who died in the disaster in 1989 , were unlawfully killed .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield news
